item.title: Large builder's bucket filled with waste dumped on pavement, 4th November
item.description:
Witnessed a Creteprint van pull up today with the side door open. There were 2 men inside the van and the non-driver got out and a put a builder's bucket out on the pavement. He began to stuff the bucket with material and black and yellow tape. I thought maybe it had come loose in the van and he was making it secure. However, the man got back in the van and left the bucket on the pavement. They then drove off! I think Creteprint do driveways as I've seen their vans and adverts before. I didn't get the number plate as I didn't think they'd drive off. Attached is a photo of the flytip outside 561/563 Footscray Road, New Eltham SE9 3UF

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 555, Footscray Road, New Eltham, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Danger to pedestrians and drivers, 4th November
item.description:
A damaged car is mounted on a pedestrian crossing island on the junction of Copers Cope Road and Southend Road. The damaged car has not been removed since it was involved in an accident on Saturday. The obstruction makes it dangerous for pedestrians to cross Copers Cope Road safely. The obstruction makes it dangerous for cars at the junction, as it obstructs visibility to / from Southend Road. The situation is made worse by the footpath being closed next to Berwick Court, forcing pedestrians to cross in this dangerous situation. A combination of failures (car has not been removed in 3 days, closing the footpath to remove non-compliant scaffolding, poor existing junction design) have led to a dangerous situation, putting pedestrians and drivers at risk. I would not be surprised if there was another accident in this evening's rush hour.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Copers Cope Road, New Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet
